revisions.rev:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Anthem Lights | image = File:anthem-lights-medium.jpg | caption = Performing at the Rock & Worship Roadshow in 2011 | image_size = | background = group_or_band | origin = {{flagicon|USA}} [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], [[Tennessee]], [[United States|USA]] | years_active = 2007-present | genre = [[Pop rock]], [[Christian rock]], [[Christian pop]] | label = [[Reunion Records]] | associated_acts = [[Building 429]], [[Revive (band)|Revive]] | website = [http://anthemlights.com www.anthemlights.com] | current_members = Chad Graham
Caleb Grimm
Kyle Kupecky
Alan Powell | past_members = }} '''Anthem Lights''', formerly known as '''Yellow Cavalier''', is an [[United States|American]] [[Contemporary Christian music|Christian]] [[boy band]] originating from [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], [[Tennessee]]. The group has released one [[Extended play|EP]] under their former name[http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/cdreviews/YellowCavalierEP.asp Jesusfreakhideout.com: Yellow Cavalier, "Yellow Cavalier EP" Review] jesusfreakhideout.com. Retrieved 04-20-2011. and one [[Extended play|EP]] under their current name.{{cite web|title=Jesusfreakhideout.com: Anthem Lights, "Anthem Lights EP" Review|url=http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/cdreviews/AnthemLightsEP.asp|publisher=jesusfreakhideout.com|accessdate=2011-04-22}} The group's [[Anthem Lights (album)|debut album]] was released May 10, 2011 by [[Reunion Records]].[http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/cdreviews/AnthemLights.asp Jesusfreakhideout.com: Anthem Lights, "Anthem Lights" Review] jesusfreakhideout.com. Retrieved 04-20-2011. ==Beginning== ===Solo project (2007)=== Anthem Lights began as a solo project for [[Singing|vocalist]] Chad Graham in the fall of 2007.{{cite web|title=Anthem Lights Artist Profile - Biography And Discography - NewReleaseTuesday.com|url=http://www.newreleasetuesday.com/artistdetail.php?artist_id=3333|publisher=newreleasetuesday.com|accessdate=2011-04-22}} Both he and [[singer-songwriter]] Alan Powell were living in [[Los Angeles]], writing music for Graham's solo project. As the final vocal work was being installed, Powell and Graham came to a realization that the songs being written would be more appropriate performed as a group.{{cite web|title=YouTube - Meet Anthem Lights|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rG71TiZFu04|publisher=youtube.com|accessdate=2011-04-22}} It was then that Powell and Graham decided to alert their contacts at [[Liberty University]] in an effort to recruit members for what was now a [[Musical ensemble|singing group]]. Powell and Graham's contacts came to a consensus that Kyle Kupecky and Caleb Grimm would be the best candidates for the project. After receiving notifications by [[Email|e-mail]], Graham flew from [[Los Angeles]] to meet with Kupecky and Grimm, who gladly accepted membership. Powell joined the group at the last minute. ===Yellow Cavalier (2008-2009)=== The original name of the group was Yellow Cavalier.{{cite web|title=Jesusfreakhideout.com: Anthem Lights Discography, Yellow Cavalier, Anthem Lights Artist Database|url=http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/artists/AnthemLights.asp|publisher=jesusfreakhideout.com|accessdate=2011-04-22}} After the group formed, this name was chosen. The group recorded one [[Yellow Cavalier (EP)|self-titled EP]] under this name in 2009. The [[Extended play|EP]] was released independently on May 26, 2009. The group changed their name to Anthem Lights before any other projects were released. ==Name change and record deal (2010)== The group's name changed to Anthem Lights sometime after their [[Yellow Cavalier (EP)|independent release]] as Yellow Cavalier. Months later, the group signed to [[Reunion Records]]. The exact dates of the name change and record deal are unknown.{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}} Vocalist Kyle Kupecky comments about the meaning behind the name: {{cquote|These songs [and] this record is our anthem to the world saying, "Listen, we know there's a lot of darkness in this life, but in the end, light is gonna win." And we wanna be the light to people and just show them who the light of the world is.}} ==Self-titled releases (2011)== On February 1, 2011, Anthem Lights released the ''[[Anthem Lights (EP)|Anthem Lights]]'' [[Extended play|EP]]. Although it was the second [[Extended play|EP]] by the group, it was the first on [[Reunion Records]] and the first under their current name. The [[Extended play|EP]] received very positive reviews[http://www.newreleasetuesday.com/albumdetail.php?album_id=9933 Anthem Lights EP by Anthem Lights | CD Reviews And Information | NewReleaseTuesday.com] newreleasetuesday.com. Retrieved 04-22-2011. and chart success as "Can't Shut Up," the first track from the [[Extended play|EP]], peaked at #42 on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'''s [[Christian Songs]] chart[http://www.billboard.com/#/song/anthem-lights/can-t-shut-up/25013221 Can't Shut Up - Anthem Lights | Billboard.com] billboard.com. Retrieved 04-22-2011. and at #27 on the CHR radio charts.[http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/news/2011/03/07.POP%20GROUP%20ANTHEM%20LIGHTS%20ANNOUNCES%20DEBUT%20ALBUM%20ON%20REUNION%20RECORDS,%20SET%20TO%20RELEASE%20MAY%2010.asp Jesusfreakhideout.com: Music News, March 2011: POP GROUP ANTHEM LIGHTS ANNOUNCES DEBUT ALBUM ON REUNION RECORDS, SET TO RELEASE MAY 10] jesusfreakhideout.com. Retrieved 04-22-2011. The three-track [[Extended play|EP]] is being deemed a sampler as all of the tracks on it will be featured on their [[Anthem Lights (album)|debut album]], which is also self-titled. The [[Anthem Lights (album)|album]] was released May 10, 2011. The cover art is similar to the [[Anthem Lights (EP)|EP]] in that it simply the official band photo under the official band logo. The only difference is the background color. ==National tours (2011-present)== [[File:AnthemLights2Road&WorshipRoadshow2011.jpg|thumb|right|Chad Graham (left) and Alan Powell (right) performing on the 2011 Rock & Worship Roadshow]] Anthem Lights performed on the Listen to the Sound Tour.[http://www.itickets.com/tours/1027.html Listen to the Sound Tour] itickets.com. Retrieved 04-22-2011. The tour was [[Headliner (performances)|headlined]] by [[Building 429]], since the tour carried the same name as their latest album, and it featured [[Revive (band)|Revive]]. Anthem Lights performed on the 2011 Rock & Worship Roadshow tour along with [[MercyMe]], [[Jars of Clay]], and [[The Afters]]. ==Group members== ===Current members=== *Chad Graham - [[Singing|vocals]] *Caleb Grimm - [[Singing|vocals]] *Kyle Kupecky - [[Singing|vocals]] *Alan Powell - [[Singing|vocals]] ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {|class="wikitable" ! Released ! Title ! [[Record label|Label(s)]] |- |May 10, 2011 |''[[Anthem Lights (album)|Anthem Lights]]'' |[[Reunion Records]] |} ===Studio EPs=== {|class="wikitable" ! Released ! Title ! [[Record label|Label(s)]] |- |May 26, 2009 |''[[Yellow Cavalier (EP)|Yellow Cavalier]]'' |(independent) |- |February 1, 2011 |''[[Anthem Lights (EP)|Anthem Lights]]'' |[[Reunion Records]] |} ==References== '''All dates are MM-DD-YYYY at UTC''' {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://anthemlights.com Official site] [[Category:American Christian musical groups]] [[Category:Christian pop groups]] [[Category:American boy bands]]
